channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chance of Finding More Survivors of Texas Flooding Dims as Search Continues
item.description: At least 120 people have died and some 173 people remain unaccounted for statewide after flash floods ravaged the Texas Hill Country last Friday.

item.title: The S&P is soaring, but fewer companies are setting record highs. Why that could be a red flag for the market
item.description: Pay attention to market breadth, analysts say.

item.title: The Gen Z glossary for Gen X managers: Here’s what your workers mean by ‘menty B’ and ‘cozzie livs’
item.description: It won’t be long until Gen X managers feel left out of watercooler chats with their twentysomething-year-old workers.

item.title: Linda Yaccarino brought some advertisers back to X—but the real power was always with owner Elon Musk
item.description: The former NBCUniversal exec is leaving after two years, following Musk's sale of X to his own company xAI.

item.title: Russia Bombards Ukraine as U.S. Frustration Mounts
item.description: Kyiv was the main target of an hourslong assault that killed at least two people, officials said. The barrage came hours before the top American and R...

item.title: It’s a cruel summer for student loan borrowers. Here’s how business leaders can make the case for better benefits for their employees
item.description: As the Trump administration allows garnishing wages of borrowers in default, experts say student loan benefits are a business imperative.

item.title: CEOs reacting to tariffs with wait-and-see have a dangerous misread of the moment
item.description: Tariffs aren’t the cause of disruption. They’re the accelerant—and companies risk falling behind.

item.title: These Younger Democrats Are Sick of Their Party’s Status Quo
item.description: Majority Democrats, a new group of elected officials from all levels of government, has outsized ambitions to challenge political orthodoxies and rema...

item.title: Judge Blocks Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Order in Class-Action Challenge
item.description: The federal judge reignited the legal standoff over President Trump’s efforts to deny citizenship to children born to undocumented parents.

item.title: How El Salvador Is Reaping Rewards From Trump’s Deportation Agenda
item.description: In exchange for jailing more than 200 deportees, El Salvador’s president, Nayib Bukele, has become a favorite of the Trump administration.

item.title: How El Salvador Is Reaping Rewards From Trump’s Deportation Agenda
item.description: In exchange for jailing more than 200 deportees, El Salvador’s president, Nayib Bukele, has become a favorite of the Trump administration.

item.description: Flattery and pressure — coupled with President Trump’s growing dissatisfaction with President Vladimir V. Putin — have helped build momentum for new e...

item.title: Russia Bombards Ukraine as U.S. Frustration Mounts

item.title: Ukrainian Intelligence Officer Is Shot to Death in Kyiv
item.description: The victim’s unit played a key role in Ukraine’s surprise attack inside Russian territory last summer.

item.title: La Scala Warns Opera Patrons: No Flip-Flops or Tank Tops Allowed
item.description: Milan’s famed opera house is cracking down on the underdressed, even as it and other European opera companies try to attract a wider audience.
